page.title: 20Summary(Contd.):Hadleigh
page.content:
Some of the material entered is very unrepresentative - most classes would not have as many fish,for example,and certainly not as many frogs! The food section was difficult to arrange as many children simply put sandwiches for lunch and chips for dinner. Convenience or "junk" food reigned supreme.The one example included is more interesting but certainly not representative. On the other hand it seems that many people do spend all their spare time watching television. This is not a complete picture of Hadleigh as our block does not include the main industrial areas.Although the block is mainly farmland our children are not country children,and have little contact with the farms.
M.Garland 1985
